full_threads.body:
Hi Karlo,

Sure, noted on this one, the post excerpt is a good idea. You can add a dropdown for list of researchers name and also there is a custom search filter api that we could look into.

Awesome, Let us know if need a hand.

Hi Joel

Please disregard this last enquiry re: submissions search. I might try another way. I'll reach out again if I can't figure it out.

thanks
Karlo

Karlo Aliling​​​​

Design Lead

MS Australia

1300 010 158

karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au

•

http://www.msaustralia.org.au/

Suite 3.01, 18 Flour Mill Way, Summer Hill NSW 2130

Thanks Joel.

If that's the case, I'll manually create excerpts with the project title and researcher name on each project post. Because they specifically want both items as the search parameter. Might work for what they need for now.

I'm also working on the submissions search https://www.msaustralia.org.au/submissions-v2/

I created a new taxonomy: Submissions Keywords and would like to use this for the search. This is the settings I did but it's not working when I type a keyword in the search field.

Can you please advise? Thanks!






Karlo Aliling​​​​

Design Lead

MS Australia

1300 010 158

karlo.aliling@msaustralia.org.au

•

http://www.msaustralia.org.au/

Suite 3.01, 18 Flour Mill Way, Summer Hill NSW 2130

Hi Karlo,

We are investigating this feature, at the moment, it doesn't have a feature yet, that would search the post title and its meta data. However, there is settings to search it by meta data only.

action.text: Chris Paradowski assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel

Is there a way for this smart filter search to include other fields? For example, if the user types the researcher's name (under the researcher field) it does not come up in the results. I currently have it set to default WordPress search but it looks like it's only searching the keyword from the title and summary I think.

https://www.msaustralia.org.au/projects
https://www.msaustralia.org.au/wp-admin/admin.php?page=jet-smart-filters#/47025

Thank you
Karlo
